Well, let me tell you, if there is an effect, it's a positive one. Samsung no longer has NVIDIA parts in any new, significant products.

Topic.Title: Why nvidia tegra line loses money

Message.Msg: You really are a brain dead idiot. First you mention Icera not Tegra. Since you can't back up your lies about Tegra you switch to Icera. Goodwill also has nothing to do with weather a division is profitable it is just the premium paid over net assets acquired. And all Nvidia has stated is that the goodwill from the acquisition of Icera should be allocated to their Consumer Products Business. Oh and Nvidia bought Icera at a bargain price of $367 million since the company was expecting an IPO in the $600 million to $1 billion range in 2010. Quote: Fortunately, companies with 550-plus patents in wireless technology do still have a decent market value, especially to ambitious mobile chip companies with no wireless to speak of and a bank account bulging from a recent legal knock-out against Intel. The $367 million shelled out by Nvidia seems a fair price, especially since they'll also get some good engineers, some decent designs and a bit more respect in the Far East. But it's a long way from a billion dollar payday. VCs don't normally aim for 'a fair price' when it comes to collect their winnings; a company that turns $260 million to $367 million over eight years, and that probably at gunpoint from the bankers, is not really what they sign up for. Especially given the state of the market: there simply aren't many Nvidias out there, and next year might have been too late. http://www.zdnet.com/nvidias-icera-deal-hides-bleak-outlook-for-eu-wireless-4010022411/

Topic.Title: Why nvidia tegra line loses money

Message.Msg: Guys, look at the GROWTH! :-) Anyone bashing Tegra is either shortsighted, scared sh1*less or accumulating cheap shares. "Nvidia maintains its guidance for 50% year-over-year Tegra growth to roughly $540 million in calendar 2012. Of note, 50% of Tegra revenue in fiscal-first-quarter came from tablets, and we expect continued Tegra growth with the ramp of HTC's [of Taiwan] One X and other smartphones and tablets in second-half 2012. We see further potential upside to Tegra revenue from the following growth drivers: 1) Tegra 3 long-term-evolution (LTE) smartphones design wins; 2) affordable [ Google (GOOG)] Android-based tablet ramp in the second half; and 3) Windows 8 on Arm-based notebooks/tablets."

Topic.Title: $19-$25 when new Kindle deal is sealed!

Message.Msg: That was tegra 2. S4 quad-core is the 2nd generation of quad-core SoC. (tegra 3 being the first). I have no doubt when tegra "Wayne" comes out it will beat the S4 quad-core. It is just different product cycles. It is way too expensive to be the first at every refresh. Tegra 3 is not years ahead of S4. 1) S4 quad-core is 28nm based while Tegra 3 is 40nm based (lower production cost and more power efficient) 2) S4 quad-core is ARM Cortex-A15 based while Tegra 3 is Cortex-A9 based. (A15 has performance edge and more power efficient) 3) S4 quad-core also has improved GPU performance. 4) S4 quad-core is "currently in production" based on recent news on the LG phone.

Topic.Title: QCOM steps into the quad-core ring!!!

Message.Msg: at the end of the day, it was nvda who lost it. Despite pumping huge $s into the project, engineering could not deliver in time. First with Tegra 3, now with Wayne. Ah I am sure Jen will not quit now, but really it's over. With qcom coming out with integrated chips/chip sets, nobody is going to bother with discretes anymore.

Topic.Title: QCOM steps into the quad-core ring!!!

Message.Msg: And it's only good enough for heavily subsidized Cell Phones but grossly deficient for Tablets. Poor QCOM - they were right about Cell Phones not needing the power of a Quad Core - all they do with a QCOM chip is play angry birds on the tiny heavily subsidized Cell Phone screens. Now if you were on a tablet - you would be doing serious stuff like Microsoft Office, real MAN DX11 games etc. S4 Pro is way overpriced that's why no Tablet manufacturer would want to take the risk of launching an S4 Pro tablet besides DX11 issues for WnRT. A phone manufacturer can build and sell a T3 phone for 1999 Yuan and be profitable - an S4 Pro selling at Y1999 is below costs according to the manufacturer - so, not sure how that works without heavy subsidies by the telco. With tablets where there are no subsidies - the S4 is way overpriced. To be sure we understand this - the T3 is 5X better performance than the T2 but a T3 tablet is cheaper than the old T2 tablets - the QCOM S4 is not 5X the performance of the T3 but it probably cost almost 5X that of the T3. That's laughable.

Topic.Title: QCOM steps into the quad-core ring!!!

Message.Msg: - Qualcomm now has a whole fleet of 28 nanometer Quad-Core S4's. Thirteen (13) to be exact. And all but one have those teeny-tiny integrated Qualcomm radios -- that nvidia has been incapable of making -- right there on the same tiny piece of silicon that the Qualcomm designed quad processors are on. Take a look at all the amazing Qualcomm S4s, boys. Scroll all the way down to long list that says "Snapdragon S4" at the bottom. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snapdragon_(system_on_chip) "Compared to System on chips from many competitors [like nvidia], Snapdragon SoCs have been unique in that they have had the modem for cellular communication on-die. That is, they do not require a separate external modem on the PCB. Since Snapdragon S4, the majority of S4 SoCs also features on-die WiFi, GPS/GLONASS and Bluetooth. This integration reduces the complexity and cost of the final design for the OEM. It also has the advantage of benefiting from advancements made in the manufacturing process, for example 28 nm in most S4 SoCs, thus providing modems and other dedicated circuitry with lower power characteristics than external chips [like Icera's] manufactured with older [40nm] processes. Wow! And just look at this boys! The Snapdragon S4's work just fine with Windows 8 too. "The Adreno 225 GPU in Snapdragon S4 SoCs adds support for DirectX 9.3 which makes it compatible with Microsoft Windows 8." Too bad nvidia doesn't have any 28 Nanometer Tegras, right boys? Tegras processors all have those clunky old 40 nanometer pathways. That suck juice like an Elephant, don't u know. Nor does nvidia make any Tegras with integrated radios. Like those Swiss Army Knife S4 Snapdragons. Maybe two or three years, right boys. Maybe -- just maybe -- nvidia can get to where Qualcomm is in 2012. Of course, Qualcomm will be miles down the road by then in mobile chip designs. It kinda looks like the Wile E. Coyote and the Roadrunner, right boys? nvidia will never catch Qualcomm. Nope. Jen will just have a plate of uneaten ACME bird seed. And shattered dreams. -

Samsung Exhibit 4G 6. Samsung Fascinate 7. Samsung Galaxy Ace 8. Samsung Galaxy Prevail 9. Samsung Galaxy S 10. Samsung Galaxy S 4G 11. Samsung Galaxy S II (AT&T) 12. Samsung Galaxy S II (i9100) 13. Samsung Galaxy S II (T-Mobile) 14. Samsung Galaxy S II (Epic 4G Touch) 15. Samsung Galaxy S II (Skyrocket) 16. Samsung Galaxy S Showcase 17. Samsung Galaxy Tab 18. Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 (WiFi) 19. Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 (4G LTE) 20. Samsung Gem 21. Samsung Indulge 22. Samsung Infuse 4G 23. Samsung Intercept 24. Samsung Mesmerize 25. Samsung Nexus S 4G 26. Samsung Replenish 27. Samsung Transform 28. Samsung Vibrant Twenty Eight (28) patent-infringing Samsung cellphones and tablets. That ALL need to be re-designed before they can be sold in the U.S. A Crushing verdict for Samsung's engineers, right boys? Who thought they were going on vacation this summer. Maybe a Napa Valley wine tasting tour? Oh no no no. Not any more. The only thing tasting Magnificent is Apple's iVictory over Samsung. -
